definition: without authority/to usurp/to arrogate to oneself/to monopolize/expert in/to be good at
to rush/to charge/to dash/to break through/to temper oneself (through battling hardships)

sentences.english: The guards thought they illegally military wharf, so they opened fire.
sentences.chinese: 警卫以为他们擅闯军事码头，所以便冲他们开了枪。

sentences.english: Their territory is often "posted" with the skulls of trespassers.
sentences.chinese: 他们的领土经常用擅闯者的头骨“标记”。

sentences.english: One really can't be too careful about invasion.
sentences.chinese: 对擅闯民宅这种事，人们也不能太在意了。

sentences.english: Ha! Cursed 6)paleface, do you dare to enter the camp of Red Chief ?
sentences.chinese: 哈，该死的白脸鬼，你胆敢擅闯红酋长的营地？

sentences.english: He told me I was trespassing on private land.
sentences.chinese: 他说我在擅闯私人土地。

sentences.english: My first thought was that someone had illegally entered my apartment and was intent on robbery or foul play.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一个反应就是有人擅闯民宅，想抢劫或是谋杀。

definition: to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
to display shockingly bad behavior/to behave atrociously
against orders/to disobey/to refuse to accept orders
to abscond/to be absent without leave
forbidden area/restricted area/(fig.) sth considered off-limits
